results.title: A Few things I know about her
results.brief_description: Six short films which look at issues of femininity, body image, gender roles and which celebrate aspects of being a woman. A fascinating insight into what makes women tick.

results.title: A Farmer's boy
results.brief_description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. Shows the work of Seale-Hayne Agricultural College, Devon including students pig feeding, milking, butter making, poultry rearing, ploughing, machine maintenance and sheep shearing.
results.description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. results.title: A Family group
results.creator_credit: Ivor Wood, Michael Bond and FilmFair
results.brief_description:
Animated children’s story about Paddington Bear and his adventures. In this chapter Paddington goes out and buys a camera so that he can take a photograph of the family.
Adapted from Chapter 1 from the book: More about paddington. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: A Fair go in life
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the Supplementary Grants Program at Springvale Primary School, a disadvantage school. Notes in particular the process involved in opening the lines of communication between the school and the community.

results.title: A Failure to communicate
results.creator_credit: Justin Shortal, Neil Barrett and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Focuses on the importance of interactive talk in learning and looks at five different communication situations, each of which is shown in two different versions involving students and teachers.

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: A study of death and dying with emphasis on giving the terminally ill patient a choice in making decisions until the end. A nurse at a Pennsylvania hospital has developed a unique program for the dying patient. Looks at the prospect of death and what can be done to make it easier for the patient and family.

results.title: A Dolphin's story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Everard, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A bottlenose dolphin is captured in the Marlborough Sounds. The good natured animal is transported to “Marineland of New Zealand” in Napier and trained there. The film records its story through to the first public performance.

results.title: A Discussion of Frank Stockton's 'The Lady, or the tiger?'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A study of the classic short story by American writer, Frank R. Stockton. Uses “historical” footage interspersed with dramatic narrative finishing with taunting question of suitor’s choice of doom - the tiger or the lady.
